triples.name: Communication protocol
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes and synthesizes networked systems under the effects of communication protocols, making protocols a core concept used throughout.

triples.name: Networked control system
triples.relevance: Networked control systems are the primary subject of analysis in this survey, examining control and filtering problems in networks.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control theory provides the theoretical framework for addressing control problems in networked systems discussed throughout the survey.

triples.name: Filter (signal processing)
triples.relevance: Signal filtering is one of the two main problem categories (control and filtering) addressed in the survey.

triples.name: Stability theory
triples.relevance: Stability analysis is a key research focus mentioned as a particular effort in the paper, essential for assessing networked system behavior.

triples.name: Fault detection and isolation
triples.relevance: Fault diagnosis and detection is one of the systematic review areas covered in the paper for communication-protocol-based systems.
